qas.question: In what year did the Tito-Stalin split occur?
In what year was Tito inaugurated as president?
In what year was Tito's funeral?
Who was the founder of the Non-Aligned Movement?
Who was inauguarated as President of Yugoslavia in 1953?

context: The decorations were seldom displayed, however. After the Tito–Stalin split of <a0_0>1948<a0_0/> and his inauguration as president in <a1_0>1953<a1_0/>, <a4_0>Tito<a4_0/> rarely wore his uniform except when present in a military function, and then (with rare exception) only wore his Yugoslav ribbons for obvious practical reasons. The awards were displayed in full number only at his funeral in <a2_0>1980<a2_0/>. <a3_0>Tito<a3_0/>'s reputation as one of the Allied leaders of World War II, along with his diplomatic position as the founder of the Non-Aligned Movement, was primarily the cause of the favorable international recognition.
